p: Finally, we explored whether MusA or MusB could support activity of polymerases derived from other IAV strains or from IBV. As seen for Vic/75 polymerase, MusA was nonfunctional for IAV polymerases from A/Tky/50-92/91 and A/Eng/195 ( Fig. 6a and b); however, IBV Florida 06 polymerase recovered some activity in dKO cells in the presence of MusA ( Fig. 6c). MusB, however, was the more potent factor for support of IBV polymerase. Intriguingly, IBV Florida 06 polymerase activity was even greater in the presence of the MusA/MusB chimera than in that of MusB alone ( Fig. 6c).
